channel.title: News : NPR
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2022 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: ¿Cómo ha afectado su vida la ley de aborto estatal? Comparta su historia
item.description: Las leyes que restringen el aborto están afectando la vida de las personas en formas grandes y pequeñas. Si han tenido un impacto en su vida o en la vida de su familia, NPR quiere oir de usted.

encoded.__cdata:
Las leyes que restringen el aborto están afectando la vida de las personas en formas grandes y pequeñas. Si han tenido un impacto en su vida o en la vida de su familia, NPR quiere oir de usted.

(Image credit: CHANDAN KHANNA/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: A former UCLA student was sentenced to over three years in prison for Capitol riot
item.description: Christian Secor, a former UCLA student and follower of the far-right racist livestreamer Nick Fuentes, was sentenced on Wednesday for obstructing congress during the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.

encoded.__cdata:
Christian Secor, a former UCLA student and follower of the far-right racist livestreamer Nick Fuentes, was sentenced on Wednesday for obstructing congress during the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.

(Image credit: Department of Justice)

item.title: 'Swift-footed lizard' is named the Massachusetts state dinosaur
item.description: Podokesaurus holyokensis, which lived millions of years ago in what is now Massachusetts, has been named the state's official dinosaur under legislation signed into law by Gov. Charlie Baker.

encoded.__cdata:
Podokesaurus holyokensis, which lived millions of years ago in what is now Massachusetts, has been named the state's official dinosaur under legislation signed into law by Gov. Charlie Baker.

(Image credit: FunkMonk Michael B.H. via AP)

item.title: The Sanibel Island causeway washed out by Hurricane Ian has reopened
item.description: The causeway linking the island to the Florida mainland reopened with temporary repairs just three weeks after it was washed out by the hurricane. The reopening will help recovery work on the island.

encoded.__cdata:
The causeway linking the island to the Florida mainland reopened with temporary repairs just three weeks after it was washed out by the hurricane. The reopening will help recovery work on the island.

(Image credit: Gerald Herbert/AP)

item.title: Nestlé recalls its stuffed chocolate chip cookie dough
item.description: The voluntary recall is for Nestlé Toll House Stuffed Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough with Fudge Filling products manufactured between June and September. Some consumers found plastic pieces in them.

encoded.__cdata:
The voluntary recall is for Nestlé Toll House Stuffed Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough with Fudge Filling products manufactured between June and September. Some consumers found plastic pieces in them.

(Image credit: Nestlé USA)

item.title: Does Marjorie Taylor Greene represent the future of the Republican Party?
item.description: Journalist Robert Draper says the GOP's embrace of extremism opened the door to fringe actors, who've become among the party's most influential leaders. His new book is Weapons of Mass Delusion.

encoded.__cdata:
Journalist Robert Draper says the GOP's embrace of extremism opened the door to fringe actors, who've become among the party's most influential leaders. His new book is Weapons of Mass Delusion.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Herschel Walker plans to hand out fake police badges to highlight support for police
item.description: After being called out for flashing an honorary police badge at a debate, Herschel Walker's campaign is embracing the moment with plans to distribute 1,000 fake badges as a fundraising prop tomorrow.

encoded.__cdata:
After being called out for flashing an honorary police badge at a debate, Herschel Walker's campaign is embracing the moment with plans to distribute 1,000 fake badges as a fundraising prop tomorrow.

(Image credit: Screen grab/Twitter)

item.title: A rare but dangerous flesh-eating bacteria is infecting Florida residents
item.description: Hurricane Ian caused storm surges of up to 12 feet, leaving behind warm, brackish floodwaters where Vibrio vulnificus thrives.

encoded.__cdata:
Hurricane Ian caused storm surges of up to 12 feet, leaving behind warm, brackish floodwaters where Vibrio vulnificus thrives.

(Image credit: Jim Watson/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Ukrainians keep a wary eye on U.S. midterm elections, fearing a loss of support
item.description: The likelihood that Republicans may win the House has triggered concerns in Ukraine. Last month, most House Republicans voted against a funding package that included billions earmarked for Ukraine.

encoded.__cdata:
The likelihood that Republicans may win the House has triggered concerns in Ukraine. Last month, most House Republicans voted against a funding package that included billions earmarked for Ukraine.

(Image credit: Franco Ordoñez/NPR)

item.title: Putin orders martial law in occupied Ukrainian areas as Kyiv's forces gain ground
item.description: The move signals Russia's growing frustration over Ukrainian advances in areas the Kremlin claimed to annex. It came hours after Kremlin-appointed officials ordered civilians to evacuate Kherson.

encoded.__cdata:
The move signals Russia's growing frustration over Ukrainian advances in areas the Kremlin claimed to annex. It came hours after Kremlin-appointed officials ordered civilians to evacuate Kherson.

(Image credit: Sergei Ilyin/Sputnik/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Enrollment in Korean classes has shot up. Thank K-pop
item.description: College student enrollment in language classes has plateaued in recent years, but enrollment in Korean language classes rose 78% from 2009 to 2016.

encoded.__cdata:
College student enrollment in language classes has plateaued in recent years, but enrollment in Korean language classes rose 78% from 2009 to 2016.

(Image credit: Jordan Strauss/Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP)

item.title: Online platforms radicalized the Buffalo mass shooting suspect, a new report says
item.description: The New York attorney general's office said it reviewed thousands of pages of documents and social media content to study how the suspect used online platforms to plan and publicize the mass shooting.

encoded.__cdata:
The New York attorney general's office said it reviewed thousands of pages of documents and social media content to study how the suspect used online platforms to plan and publicize the mass shooting.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke/AP)

item.title: Val Demings goes on attack against Marco Rubio in Florida Senate debate
item.description: Democratic U.S. Rep. Val Demings of Florida went on the attack Tuesday in her first debate against Republican Sen. Marco Rubio.

encoded.__cdata:
Democratic U.S. Rep. Val Demings of Florida went on the attack Tuesday in her first debate against Republican Sen. Marco Rubio.

(Image credit: Thomas Cordy/AP)

item.title: The family of George Floyd plans to file a $250 million lawsuit against Ye
item.description: The announcement of the lawsuit comes after Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, made comments about Floyd's death on the podcast Drink Champs.

encoded.__cdata:
The announcement of the lawsuit comes after Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, made comments about Floyd's death on the podcast Drink Champs.

(Image credit: Julien de Rosa/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: The family of slain Palestinian American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh demands justice
item.description: It's been over five months since Abu Akleh was killed on the job, most likely by Israeli forces. Her niece tells Morning Edition about her aunt's legacy and her family's campaign for accountability.

encoded.__cdata:
It's been over five months since Abu Akleh was killed on the job, most likely by Israeli forces. Her niece tells Morning Edition about her aunt's legacy and her family's campaign for accountability.

(Image credit: Rosie Scammell/AFP via Getty Images)
